snippet: When the new World Trade Center opens, a north-south thoroughfare between Battery Park and Gansevoort Street will bristle with hotels and residential projects.
abstract: New York City's Greenwich Street is poised to become a main thoroughfare running through the World Trade Center site with a repositioning resulting from the opening of a long-closed stretch of the street, which runs from Battery Park to Gansevoort Street; several hotel and residential projects are in the works, as developers hope to leverage the roadway's newfound cachet.
lead_paragraph: When the new World Trade Center opens, a north-south thoroughfare between Battery Park and Gansevoort Street will bristle with hotels and residential projects.

headline.seo: Manhattan’s Greenwich Street Poised to Reopen and Regain Prominence
headline.main: Sundered Greenwich Street Will Be Rejoined
headline.print_headline: Sundered Greenwich Street Will Be Rejoined
